dmca.title: [EV1-C1586974K] use of copyright material on websites hosted by www.groupring.com & w
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. 

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] 
Posted At: Sunday, October 29, 2006 3:20 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [EV1-C1586974K] use of copyright material on websites
hosted by www.groupring.com & www.diff-eq.com
Subject: [EV1-C1586974K] use of copyright material on websites hosted by
www.groupring.com & www.diff-eq.com


==== Original Message ====
MIME element (text/plain)
This is a formal take down notice for these websites.  The material on
these two pages is copyright to NZIMA & The University of Auckland and
has been copied direct from our website. 
 
We have also notified the whois contacts for the two domains but do not
have much hope of any action from them since they are probably the same
folk who put the pages up. 
 
Please see that these sites are taken down ASAP. 
 
Cheers, Russell 
 
Russell Fulton, Information Security Officer, The University of
Auckland. 
 
-------- Original Message --------
Subject:  contents hijack? 
Date:  Mon, 30 Oct 2006 15:21:08 +1300 (NZDT)
From:  Vincent Chung <v.chung@auckland.ac.nz>
To:  Russell Fulton <r.fulton@auckland.ac.nz>, Bojan Zdrnja
<b.zdrnja@auckland.ac.nz> 
 
 
 
Hi Bojan, Russell, 
 
Someone has setup two fake websites using the front page of our NZIMA
(www.nzima.org) group, taken from about a year ago. Our concern is that
staff member and people we work with are listed there. 
 
        http://www.groupring.com 
        http://www.diff-eq.com 
 
I found some information of their ISPs: 
"groupring.com" is hosted by "Neureal", http://www.neureal.com/
"diff-eq.com" is hosted by "ThePlanet", https://www.theplanet.com/ 
 
Both planet and neureal are reseller under "Everyones Internet " in
Texas USA. Their whois information is not very useful, as they are
"protected" 
by something called "Whois Privacy Protection Service, Inc." 
 
eg
http://whois.domaintools.com/diff-eq.com
http://whois.domaintools.com/groupring.com 
 
I imagine the same company/person stole the content, do a cut&paste job
to create these sites, these submit them to various web directories. Any
recommendation on what to do next? 
 
Vincent 
 
Vincent Chung * IT Manager
373-7599 ex 85759 * Mathematics Rm.306
